title: Processing Hydroxy-Carboxylic Acids To Polymers

abstract:
Biomass (e.g., plant biomass, animal biomass, and municipal waste biomass) is 
processed to produce useful intermediates and products, such as aliphatic hydroxy
carboxylic acid and hydroxyl-carboxylic acid derivatives. These aliphatic hydroxy
carboxylic acids are, in turn, polymerized. The polymerization is carried out using a 
thin film evaporator or a thin film polymerization/devolatilization device. Conversion 
of lactic acid to poly lactic acid is an especially useful product to this process.
claims: CLAIMS 1. A method of processing hydroxy-carboxylic acids, comprising: producing a hydroxy-carboxylic acid by fermentation of biomass derived sugars; polymerizing the hydroxy-carboxylic acid to provide a poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid; adding an aliphatic dicarboxylic acid, aromatic dicarboxylic, aliphatic diol, and/or aromatic diol to the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid to provide a mixture of poly hydroxy carboxylic acid, aliphatic dicarboxylic acid, aromatic dicarboxylic acid, aliphatic diol, and/or aromatic diol; transferring the mixture of poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid, aliphatic dicarboxylic acid, aromatic dicarboxylic acid, aliphatic diol, and/or aromatic diol to a surface of a thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device; and further polymerizing and/or crosslinking the mixture of poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid, aliphatic dicarboxylic acid, aromatic dicarboxylic acid, aliphatic diol, and/or aromatic diol by condensing the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid to provide a hydroxy-carboxylic acid polymer, wherein water is evaporated as it is formed during condensation of the poly hydroxy carboxylic acid as it traverses the surface of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, and the aliphatic dicarboxylic acid, aromatic dicarboxylic acid, aliphatic diol, and/or aromatic diol are incorporated into the hydroxy-carboxylic acid polymer.
2. The method of claim 1, further comprising polymerizing the hydroxy-carboxylic acid in the presence of a polymerization catalyst.

3. The method of claim 1, wherein an extruder is in fluid communication with the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, optionally wherein an effluent of the extruder is the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid, and/or the effluent of the extruder is recycled to the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the extruder is a twin screw extruder.

5. The method of any one of claims 1-4, wherein the hydroxy-carboxylic acid is selected from the group consisting of glycolic acid, D-lactic acid, L-lactic acid, D-malic acid, L-malic acid, citric acid, L-tartaric acid, D-tartaric acid, beta-hydroxy beta-methylbutyric acid, 4 hydroxy-4-methylpentanoic acid, hydroxybutyric acid, 2-hydroxybutyric acid, beta hydroxybutyric acid, gamma-hydroxybutyric acid, 3-hydroxyisobutyric acid, 3 hydroxypentanoic acid, 3-hydroxypropionic acid alpha, beta-hydroxyvaleric acid, gamma hydroxyvaleric acid, and delta-hydroxyvaleric acid, and combinations thereof.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the hydroxy-carboxylic acid is D-lactic acid and/or L lactic acid.

7. The method of any one of claims 1-6, wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a temperature between 100 °C and 260 °C.

8. The method of any one of claims 1-7, wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure of less than or equal to 0.0001 torr.

9. The method of any one of the claims 2-8, wherein prior to transferring the poly hydroxy carboxylic acid to the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, or during operation of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, a catalyst deactivator and/or stabilizer agent is added.

10. The method of any one of the claims 1-8, wherein one or more cyclic dimers derived from the hydroxy-carboxylic acid are less than 5 weight percent based on the total mass of the hydroxy-carboxylic acid, poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid, and hydroxy-carboxylic acid polymer.

11. The method of any one of claims 1-10, where an aliphatic dicarboxylic acid and/or an aromatic dicarboxylic acid and an aliphatic diol and/or an aromatic diol is added just prior to transferring the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid to the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device.

12. The method of any one of claims 1-11, wherein the mole ratio of the aliphatic dicarboxylic acid and/or the aromatic dicarboxylic acid to the aliphatic diol and/or the aromatic diol is 0.95:1 to 1.05:1.

13. The method of any one of claims 1-12, wherein the mole ratio of the sum of the aliphatic dicarboxylic acid and/or the aromatic dicarboxylic acid and the aliphatic diol and/or the aromatic diol to the hydroxy-carboxylic acid is 0.1 or less.

14. The method of any one of claims 1-13, wherein the mole ratio of the sum of the aliphatic dicarboxylic acid and/or the aromatic dicarboxylic acid and the aliphatic diol and/or the aromatic diol to the hydroxy-carboxylic acid is 0.05 or less.

15. The method of any one of the claims 2-14, wherein the polymerization catalyst is selected from the group consisting of protonic acids, H 3 PO 4 , H2 SO4 , methane sulfonic acid, p-toluene sulfonic acid, polymerically supported sulfonic acid, metals, Mg, Al, Ti, Zn, Sn, metal oxides, TiO 2 , ZnO, GeO2, ZrO2, SnO, SnO2, Sb 2 0 3 , metal halides, ZnC2, SnC2, SnCl 4, Mn(AcO)2, Fe2(LA)3, Co(AcO)2, Ni(AcO)2, Cu(OA)2, Zn(LA)2, Y(OA) 3 , Al(i-PrO)3, Ti(BuO) 4 , TiO(acac)2, (Bu)2SnO, Sn(II)octoate, Li carbonate, Zn diacetate dehydrate, Ti tetraisopropoxide, potassium carbonate, tin powder, solvates thereof, and combinations thereof.

16. The method of any one of claims 1-8, wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure of less than 0.001 torr, or wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure of less than 0.01 torr, or wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure of less than 0.1 torr, wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure of less than 1 torr.
17. The method of any one of claims 1-16, further comprising branching or cross-linking the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid.

18. The method of claim 17, wherein a branching or cross-linking agent is utilized to cross link the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid, optionally wherein the branching or cross-linking agent is selected from the group consisting of 5,5'-bis(oxepane-2-one)(bis--caprolactone)), spiro-bis dimethylene carbonate, peroxide, dicumyl peroxide, benzoyl peroxide, unsaturated alcohols, hydroxyethyl methacrylate, 2-butene-1,4-diol, unsaturated anhydrides, maleic anhydride, saturated epoxides, glycidyl methacrylate, and combinations thereof.

19. The method of any one of claims 1-16, wherein the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid is blended with a second polymer, either when the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid is transferred to the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, or after the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid is transferred to the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device, optionally wherein the second polymer is selected from the group consisting of polyglycols, polyvinyl acetate, polyolefins, styrenic resins, polyacetals, poly(meth)acrylates, polycarbonate, polybutylene succinate, polyesters, polyurethanes, natural rubber, polybutadiene, neoprene, silicone, other poly hydroxy carboxylic acids, and combinations thereof.

20. The method of any one of claims 1-19, comprising combining the poly hydroxy carboxylic acid with a filler, optionally wherein the filler is selected from the group consisting of silicates, layered silicates, polymer and organically modified layered silicate, synthetic mica, carbon, carbon fibers, glass fibers, boric acid, talc, montmorillonite, clay, starch, corn starch, wheat starch, cellulose fibers, paper, rayon, non-woven fibers, wood flours, whiskers of potassium titanate, whiskers of aluminum borate, 4,4' -thiodiphenol, glycerol, and combinations thereof.

21. The method of any one of claims 1-20, further comprising combining the poly hydroxyl carboxylic acid with a dye or a pigment, optionally wherein the dye or the pigment is selected from the group consisting of blue 3, blue 356, brown 1, orange 29, violet 26, violet 93, yellow 42, yellow 54, yellow 82, and combinations thereof.

22. The method of any one of claims 1-21, further comprising combining the poly hydroxy carboxylic acid with a fragrance, optionally wherein the fragrance is selected from the group consisting of wood, evergreen, redwood, peppermint, cherry, strawberry, peach, lime, spearmint, cinnamon, anise, basil, bergamot, black pepper, camphor, chamomile, citronella, eucalyptus, pine, fir, geranium, ginger, grapefruit, jasmine, juniper berry, lavender, lemon, mandarin, marjoram, musk, myrrh, orange, patchouli, rose, rosemary, sage, sandalwood, tea tree, thyme, wintergreen, ylang ylang, vanilla, new car, and combinations thereof.
23. The method of claim 22, wherein the fragrance is combined with the poly hydroxy carboxylic acid in an amount between 0.005 % by weight and 20 % by weight.

24. The method of any one of claims 1-23, wherein converting further includes blending the poly hydroxy-carboxylic acid with a plasticizer, optionally wherein the plasticizer is selected from the group consisting of triacetin, tributyl citrate, polyethylene glycol, acetic ester of monoglyceride, diethyl bishydroxymethyl malonate, and combinations thereof.

25. The method of claim 9, where the catalyst deactivator and/or stabilizer agent is selected from the group consisting of anhydrides, phosphites, polycarboxylic acids, a poly methacrylic acid, polyamines, silica, functionalized silica, alumina, aluminosilicates, clays, functionalized clays, and combinations thereof.
26. The method of any one of claims 9 or 25, comprising removing the deactivated/stabilized catalyst.

27. The method of claim 26, comprising removing the deactivated/stabilized catalyst using a filtration device, optionally wherein the filtration device is in fluid communication with the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device.

28. The method of any one of claims 2-8, wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure between 0.0001 torr and 100 torr, or wherein at least a part of the thin film evaporator and/or thin film polymerization/devolatilization device operates at a pressure between 0.001 torr and 50 torr.
